title: Chronic Hepatitis C Treatment
content: Hepatitis C treatment has been revolutionized by direct-acting antivirals, achieving cure rates >95% with 8-12 weeks of therapy. Treatment regimens are selected based on viral genotype, prior treatment history, and presence of cirrhosis. Pre-treatment assessment includes HCV RNA quantification, genotyping, fibrosis staging, and screening for drug interactions. Post-treatment monitoring includes confirming sustained virologic response and surveillance for hepatocellular carcinoma in cirrhotic patients.
